basics.name: Sundar Gurumurthy
basics.label: Computational Modelling Engineer
basics.summary: Computational engineer with 3+ years of hands-on experience in FEA, materials modeling, and design for manufacturing. Skilled in developing physics-based simulation workflows for WAAM, crashworthiness, and gear systems. Experienced in bridging academic research and industrial R&D through high-fidelity modeling and automation.

work.name: Cranfield University
work.summary: Researcher at the Welding and Additive Manufacturing Centre, supporting advanced process modeling and simulation in large-scale metal AM for aerospace, energy and nuclear sectors.
highlights: Built thermo-mechanical FEA models for WAAM processes (CW-MIG, PTA) to predict residual stresses and geometric distortion.
Implemented martensitic transformation behavior in multi-material deposition simulations.
Designed deposition strategies for complex geometries using coupled thermal-mechanical solvers.
Conducted in-situ validation via SEM, thermal imaging, and 3D scanning to calibrate models.

work.name: Sona Comstar
work.summary: Worked in the bevel gear design team, building automated design and simulation tools for drivetrain systems targeting electric vehicle platforms.
highlights: Developed parametric CAD and macro-geometry tools for bevel gear design with crowning support.
Streamlined LTCA and NVH simulations for iterative development cycles.
Created an end-to-end pipeline integrating design with version control in PLM systems.
Liaised with suppliers and internal testing teams to meet performance and manufacturability goals.

work.name: Mercedes Benz R&D India
work.summary: Supported crashworthiness simulations within the Crash Structures team, focusing on tire and composite interactions under impact.
highlights: Developed non-linear FE tire models using LS-DYNA for high-fidelity crash simulation.
Benchmarked contact algorithms and air pressure modeling under dynamic loads.
Contributed to composite material modeling validation workflows and documentation.

work.name: Daimler India Commercial Vehicles
work.summary: Supported End-of-Line operations for Mitsubishi FUSO trucks.
highlights: Conducted lean manufacturing analysis that improved rework efficiency by 0.5%.
Performed root cause investigations and developed corrective actions for production defects.

courses: Thesis: Understanding and Improving the Inherent Strain Method for Mechanical Analysis of Wire Arc Additive Manufacturing.
Key Topics: Residual stress prediction, distortion modeling, process-structure-property relations.
Supervisors: Dr. Yongle Sun & Dr. Pradeeptta Taraphdar

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science Pilani

awards.title: AIAA SmallSat Student Travel Award
awards.summary: Received industry-sponsored funding to present research at the 33rd SmallSat Conference, Logan, Utah.

publications.name: Study of Residual Stress Using Phased Array Ultrasonics in Ti-6Al-4V Wire-Arc Additively Manufactured Components
Development and Testing of an Antenna Deployment System for Nanosatellite Applications
Dynamic Active Thermal Control of a LEO Nanosatellite Based on Its Mode of Operation

volunteer.summary: Participated in the university chapter of the National Service Scheme.
highlights: Tutored underprivileged teenagers enrolled under India's Right to Education Act.
Assisted in fundraising and donation drives for student scholarships.
